title: Irish households not getting full benefit of retail investment, says Central Bank
description:
Households in the Republic hold about 38 per cent of their financial assets in deposits and cash, rather than equities, debt securities and other instruments, the Central Bank said. Photograph: iStock

title: Central Bank of Ireland Fines Coinbase Europe $24.8M for AML Failures
description:
The Central Bank of Ireland (CBI) has imposed a $24.8 million (€21.5 million) fine on Coinbase Europe for breaching anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorist financing obligations, marking Ireland's first enforcement action against a cryptocurrency company.

"To be effective in combating fin...

title: Central Bank of Ireland seeks ‘full account of what happened’ after glitch
description:
The Central Bank of Ireland is seeking a “full account” of a glitch which saw Bank of Ireland customers withdrawing or transferring more money than was in their accounts.

Minister for Finance Michael McGrath said he also wanted to know why it happened and what would be done to prevent a repeat.

Ba...

title: Central Bank of Ireland Fines Coinbase $24.6M for Anti-Money Laundering Failures
description:
The Central Bank of Ireland has fined Coinbase Europe €21.4 million ($24.6M) for breaching its anti-money laundering (AML) and counter terrorist financing transaction monitoring obligations between 2021 and 2025, the bank said on Thursday in a press release.

Coinbase Europe has been fined due to fa...

title: Making impact, inspiring futures: SETU delivers €1bn regional transformation
description:

title: South East Technological University delivers over €1 billion in economic impact
description:
According to a new report, South East Technological University (SETU) has delivered an impact of just over a billion euro to the economy.

On Wednesday, November 26, staff, students, academics, local representatives and stakeholders assembled on campus for the publication of the university’s Economi...

title: Accor appoints Graham Dodd as VP of development for UK & Ireland
description:
Graham Dodd has been appointed VP of development for UK & Ireland for French hotel giant Accor.

He will spearhead the development of Accor’s premium, midscale and economy segment across the region, overseeing the growth of brands such as Pullman, Mövenpick, Swissôtel, Novotel, Mercure, Handwritten ...

title: Simon Harris reacts to warning Ireland is budgeting ‘like there’s no tomorrow’
description:
Tánaiste Simon Harris has said the Irish economy is “in a position of relative strength” following warnings from a watchdog that the Government is “budgeting like there’s no tomorrow,” reports Breaking News.

The Irish Fiscal Advisory Council (Ifac) cautioned that long-term planning is insufficient ...

title: Government 'needs to move away from year-to-year budgeting', fiscal watchdog warns
description:
Eva Osborne

The Irish Fiscal Advisory Council has said the Government needs to "move away from year-to-year budgeting" after it warned the coalition is "budgeting like there's no tomorrow".

The fiscal watchdog said there are no budgetary forecasts beyond 2026 and that the Government has yet to sub...

title: Consumer prices rise 3.2% in 12 months to November
description:
Prices for consumer goods and services in Ireland are estimated to have increased by 3.2% in the 12 months to November, up from 2.8% the previous month.

New figures from the Central Statistics Office (CSO) show that food prices were unchanged in November, but increased by 4.2% in the past year.

title: Dublin Port charges ‘not expected’ to fuel Irish inflation, says operator
description:
Combined, the charges, which are paid by shipping companies but are likely to be passed on to hauliers, are estimated to add just over €53 to the base price of a standard 40-foot container. Photograph: Thomas Trutschel/Photothek via Getty Images

title: Solid growth in manufacturing sector in November
description:
Operating conditions in Ireland's manufacturing sector improved in November, according to the latest AIB Purchasing Managers' Index.

The upturn was fuelled by a rise in new orders and renewed growth in production.

Optimism across the sector surged to an 11 month high, however hiring came to a near...

title: Irish inflation climbs over 3% again on higher energy and food prices
description:
Food prices are now one of the main drivers of overall inflation.

Inflation in Ireland has climbed to more than 3 per cent again, driven by higher energy and food prices.

The latest flash estimate for the harmonised index of consumer prices (HICP) put the annualised rate of price growth at 3.2 per...

title: "All Optics"- Waterford businesses hit back at Chief Executive's plan to raise rates
description:
Waterford City and County Council Chief Executive Sean McKeown has recommended that commercial rates be raised by 3.5% ahead of the council’s statutory budget meeting on Wednesday.

title: RBI MPC Meet HIGHLIGHTS: No change in rates –Governor Sanjay Malhotra says ‘geopolitical tensions pose risks to the growth outlook’
description: RBI Monetary Policy, MPC Meet 2025 Highlights: The Reserve Bank of India‘s (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has kept key interest rates unchanged at 5.50 per cent and the real GDP growth for FY26 is projected at 6.5 per cent. title: RBI Monetary Policy Highlights: December 2024
description:
On Friday, December 6, 2024, the RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das announced that the central bank has kept the policy repo rate steady at 6.5%. In his speech, Governor Das highlighted consistent high food inflation is a concern. This has been contributing to the RBI’s cautious outlook on inflation.

title: Unemployment rate hits highest level since 2021, says CSO
description:
The jobless rate for people aged 15 to 65 rose to 5.3% in the third quarter of this year, up 0.8 percentage points from 4.5% at the same point in 2024.

This marks the highest level since the third quarter of 2021, when Ireland was emerging from the Covid period, reports RTE.

There were 155,400 peo...

title: October unemployment rate down from last month at 5%
description:
In October 2025, the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate was 5.0 per cent, down from the revised rate of 5.1 per cent in September 2025, according to the Central Statistics Office (CSO).

On an annual basis, the unemployment rate increased from 4.2 per cent in October 2024 to 5.0 per cent in Octob...
